review_title: Very laid back, low stress, well paying
pros: Job is very low stress, I've had no issues here. Salary is about what's typical for a college student, good for spending money. Very flexible hours.
cons: Can be boring sometimes here.

review_title: Barely scraping by  for a PhD degree
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Name recognition; I improved writing and reading skills
cons: TAship is very poorly paid, and the student health insurance is not very good.

review_title: good pay for what you are doing nothing
pros: you can study on the job but you will get fired for any little thing
cons: hard to get good hours,  night sift are  hard very boring job

review_title: I loved working here. Stress free, loved my co-workers and bosses.
job_title: Administrative Assistant I in Athens, GA
pros: Easy work environment, great benefits, growth within the company.
cons: Low wages, has to pay for parking. No discount in any of the cafeterias on campus.

job_title: Extension Program Specialist in Athens, GA
pros: Amazing professors/bosses who provide excellent guidance and support. Great opportunities to get involved in projects that will improve your resume and teach you so much. Invaluable experience!
cons: Low pay for the job requirements.

job_title: Senior Reference Assistant in Athens, GA
pros:
Basically get paid to do your homework. 
Not a very demanding job.
cons: Usually only get 6-8 hours of work a week. You can get more hours but only if you do grunt work.

review_title: Web Developer - College of Vet Med
pros: Amazing direction and guidance from the Boss, Good team environment, Flexible work schedule as long the requirements are met.
cons: I didn't find any thing wrong during the time I worked.

pros:
Great if you study parisitology because there are many labs which study parasites.
Good microscopy core. Housing is cheap.
cons: Long drive to the airport. Promote interlab collaboration. Increase internal fellowship funding.

pros:
Flexible hours as a Desk Assistant.
Can work on homework while at the desk.
Get to meet a lot of interesting people.
cons: Literally will have to have shifts in the middle of the night.

pros: The job is easy, and pays well for a student job.
cons: Management is difficult to work with, and very bad at communicating with employees

pros:
-I can study while I work
-You don't have to do anything but wipe keyboards, push in chairs, make people sign in, and prevent food from coming inside.
cons: -A bit boring at times.

pros: Supportive environment, professional development was encouraged, especially for grads, but depended on supervisor
cons: Much of your experience depends on your supervisor; Accountability is an issue

review_title: Great Employer, but salary is not high enough for the work required.
pros: Flexible hours, holidays off, working with fellow classmates.
cons: Low pay, must have a parking pass to park at work, employees are constantly changing.

review_title: Decent Work Environment but little opportunity for advancement
job_title: Research Technician III in Athens, GA
pros: Health insurance, Dental insurance, comfortable work environment.
cons: No opportunity for advancement, modest salary, no opportunities for pay increase.

review_title: Notoriously low salaries for library employees
pros: Athens is a cheap place to live. If you're a young twenty-something, you have plenty of cheap places to get drunk.
cons: Office politics. Notoriously low salaries. Little room for promotion.

pros: Great program that values it's graduate students
cons: Grad school is hard, takes a long time, and you don't get paid a lot. that's just universal

job_title: IT Support Student Worker in Athens, GA
pros: Depending on where you choose to work. I worked for Franklin IT and it was great. People are knowledgeable and flexible.
cons: As a student worker, I was onyl allowed to work for 20 hours.

pros: Lots of opportunities to learn and grow
cons: No clear, long-term direction.  Talks of outsourcing certain functions leads to lots of turn-over and minimal investment in employees in certain departments.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Athens, GA
pros: Decent hours and work culture isn't terrible. Most employees are  students and are easy to talk to.
cons: Poor optimization. Sometimes lack of proper equipment or utensils. Shifts aren't fluid. Long hours of standing. Little pay growth.

pros: Worked with other students, friendly atmosphere, and flexible hours.
cons: Pay wasn't great (even as a waitress at the restaurant, the tips were mediocre), and the management never seemed to be on top of things.

review_title: Positive Experience as Summer Student Worker
job_title: Summer Student Worker At UGA Horticulture Farm in Athens, GA
pros:
- $9 an hour for a manual labor job
- laidback, direct interview
- friendly boss
- flexibility with hours
- a positive work environment
cons:
- lots of physical labor
- no cons necessarily though

pros: The fellow people you work with are typically amazing college students.
cons: The management does not treat you everyone like they are equal. You also are required to work at least 1 'graveyard shift' a month.

review_title: Okay for student workers, not full time
job_title: Customer Service Team Lead in Athens, GA
pros: right in the middle of campus
cons: game days are a requirement and it's hours upon hours of constant rush

pros: Great people, managers and supervisors understood what students are going through. Everybody treated me nice. Great work environment. Good looking girls.
cons: Poor salary. Supervisors sometimes are not willing to let you go.

review_title: Overall, great experience working at the University of Georgia
pros: Close to housing. Lots of diversity on campus. A large network within a small town.
cons: Low salary compared to other states. Must earn sick and vacation leave.

pros: Great management, wonderful coworkers, and fun work meetings.
cons: Average pay, working at the Club Sports Complex did not have sufficient facilities to keep workers warm in winter.

pros: They were very accommodating to the time restrictions of being a student
cons: It was somewhat boring. Work was pretty mindless and easy to get through quickly, so there was a lot of down time.

job_title: Applications Programmer Specialist in Athens, GA
pros: Good place to work where you can try new technology because of the partnership the university have with many vendors
cons: there is not a clear carrear path and salaries increases are rare

pros: flexible hours, easy work, will hire anyone, you can start whenever you'd like, free meal per shift
cons: unpleasant work, rude full time staff, management is incompetent

job_title: Student Bus Operator in Athens, GA
pros: Flexible scheduling. University understands you're a student, so doesn't ask that you work excessive or demanding hours.
cons: Not much really. Need a job and/or income while being a student? Boom.

pros: Good place to live, excellent opportunities to advance in your carrier.
cons: The town is small and only the public transportation is good in the college area. Definitely need a car to get around

pros: All the professors, graduate students, and research assistants were encouraging and helpful
cons: Summer research means there are not many people on campus

review_title: It was great working at the mail room and I had a great boss.
job_title: Mail Room Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Flexible hours, kind co-workers,  employee lunch-ins
cons: Sometimes there's a heavy load of books you have to take in the van

pros: Totally depends on which professor you are working with.
cons: I did know a master student that worked in a lab for almost 3 years but did not produced any vaulable experimental results for publication.

pros: Lots of choices for majors and many people to connect with in every field. Great location in Athens as well. They also take zell miller scholarship.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: As an undergraduate with no experience, CFS is a great place to work for and gain valuable experience.
cons: Little monetary compensation. No room for career growth.

review_title: It was a fun student job
pros: Network with other college students, resume builder, can have fun while working
cons: Experiences don't necessarily apply to business world

job_title: Research Professional II in Athens, GA
pros: I love the friendly atmosphere and collaborative spirit amongst the faculty.
cons: The biggest downside is the salary. I believe the salaries tend to be $10,000/year below other universities around the country.

pros:
Great flexibility for hours and work
Fun opportunities to work cool events
cons:
Upper management isn't great
Doesn't seem like everyone cares for each other
Cost-cutting is hurting departments and people

review_title: It's a good place to have a life
pros: Public university system is good for life. City is beautiful. Life is slow here.
cons: Pressure is not great. It is good, and it could also be bad.

review_title: Lifeguard: Not bad for a student
pros: Flexible hours, fun work environment, time to study, ability to create and easily change weekly or day-to-day schedule
cons: Pay is not great, but it is a very easy job

pros:
Access to respected researchers
Access to incredible resources
cons: May be a lot of competition to get jobs

pros:
Flexible hours for students. 
A few incentives to continue working. 
Variability of work.
cons:
Minimum/non competitive pay. 
Minimal movement upwards. 
Large separation of student and non student employees.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant & Instructor in Athens, GA

cons: Very competitive. Without a doctorate it may be hard to secure a job.

job_title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great School, great environment. I have had great opportunity to be here and to know the culture and enjoy great student resources
cons: none that I can think of.

pros: Decent pay (monthly stipend), health insurance available, tuition waiver
cons: Still have to pay fees, can only work max of 20 hours/week as a student (can't pick up a second job with the University)

job_title: Student Web Developer Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Super flexible with class and schoolwork schedule. Great job for a part-time student. Location is on campus too so it's easy to get to.
cons: Not many for a student worker position

job_title: Student Affairs Professional in Athens, GA
pros: Great work-life balance, benefits, PTO, and emotionally intelligent management in my department.
cons: Low pay and career advancement limitations.

review_title: Working for the University of Georgia
pros: Great job security, great benefits, great work/life balance, nice place to live.
cons: Salary/compensation could not be any lower.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: This university has a great research opportunity, but some departments have more access to money than others.
cons: several added fees that students have to pay even if they don't use the services

review_title: It was a very interesting student job if you enjoy history or have any interest in pursuing an mlis in the future!
job_title: Student Library Assistant in Athens, GA

cons: It can be very monotonous.

pros: Free 9 hours of tuition/semester. Great work/life balance. Decent health insurance. Good retirement plan.
cons: Parking permit is a must. Meal plan is expensive. Not much room for career growth internally.

review_title: Very positive people and work environment

cons: Since I was the assistant to one department, I didn't get to interact with more people than I wanted.

pros: I love the atmosphere of the school and all the opportunities for students to get involved.
cons: Athens is a little far away from any large town, Atlanta is an hour away.

pros: Very slow paced and safe place to work. Great state benefits.

review_title: A great place to work and thrive

review_title: So much politics and little pay
